comments.content:
Hmmm, the m and n look like Dax, but the ’a’ sure doesn’t. It’s “Modula Bold” an old film type, shown in the Phil’s Photo book from 1985. The only digital version I know offhand is “Obbsidda” from NovelFonts. We had Modula recently in a question about airport type, as I recall.

- Mike Yanega

[Here](http://web.archive.org/web/20090508103300/http:/typophile.com/node/56604) is the recent thread I was recalling. There were other times this came up even earlier.

- Mike Yanega
